page.title: 06DAIRY FARMING IN CLOPHILL
page.content: At{Pedley Wood Farm}we visited a dairy herd of 50{Pedigree Jerseys.}The cows are milked twice a day by machine in the milking parlour and are fed with their ration of cattle pellets according to their milking record. The milk is then pumped into an ice-cold stainless steel tank and{450 litres are collected daily by a tanker. This is then tested, treated and bottled at {Hunstanton}before being delivered next morning on our doorsteps. Calves are taken from their Mothers after 36 hours and are hand reared. They can produce calves themselves at 2 years old. The cattle eat grass in summer but live in barns during winter when they eat silage & barley straw, both produced on the farm. The new{milk quota}allocated is too low so this herd will soon be sold & there will soon be no dairying here.
